#summary JMX based extras to ease monitoring

= Introduction =

Extras on top of Java SE (e.g. Thread Pool) and Spring Framework (e.g. JMS Listener) to ease monitoring.

= JMS Connection Factory =

ManagedConnectionFactory allows to monitor creation of JMS resources: 


|| JMX Object Name || {{{javax.jms:type=ConnectionFactory,name=${spring-bean-name} }}} where {{{${spring-bean-name} }}} is the name of the spring object ||
|| Metrics || {{{CreateConnectionCount}}}, {{{CreateConnectionExceptionCount}}} <br/>  {{{CreateMessageProducerCount}}}, {{{CreateMessageProducerExceptionCount}}} <br/>  {{{CreateMessageConsumerCount}}}, {{{CreateMessageConsumerExceptionCount}}} <br/>  {{{CreateSessionCount}}}, {{{CreateSessionExceptionCount}}} <br/> <br/> {{{SendMessageCount}}}, {{{SendMessageExceptionCount}}}, {{{SendMessageDurationInMillis}}} <br/>{{{ReceiveMessageCount}}}, {{{ReceiveMessageExceptionCount}}}, {{{ReceiveMessageDurationInMillis}}} ||
|| Sample Of Configuration || {{{test  multi ligne }}} ||


{{{
<beans ...>

   <bean id="connectionFactory" class="fr.xebia.management.jms.SpringManagedConnectionFactory">
      <property name="delegate">
         <bean class="org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQConnectionFactory">
            <property name="brokerURL" value="vm://localhost?broker.persistent=false&amp;broker.useJmx=true" />
         </bean>
      </property>
   </bean>

   ...
</beans>
}}}
